title: Kroger’s Stock Looks Inflated
sub_head: Grocery stocks have been something of a haven for investors. But it is starting to look like a crowded one.
body:
Grocery store stocks have held their value a lot better than the market this year as investors seek safety from inflation and an uncertain economic outlook. Keeping that streak going won’t be easy.
Kroger on Thursday said same-store sales excluding fuel increased 4.1% in the quarter ended May 21 compared with a year earlier, better than the 3.7% increase analysts polled by Visible Alpha had expected. Operating profit was about 7.5% higher than the number analysts were penciling in.
